bug.author: HKLee2040
bug.description: Test the world language model with following command: python3 main.py --cuda --emsize 1500 --nhid 1500 --dropout 0.65 --tied --compress=../../examples/agp-pruning/word_lang_model.LARGE_70.schedule_agp.yaml --wd=1e-6 --summary=png It gives me the following error message: Traceback (most recent call last): File "main.py", line 298, in draw_lang_model_to_file(model, 'rnn.png', 'wikitext2') File "main.py", line 108, in draw_lang_model_to_file g = apputils.SummaryGraph(model, dummy_input) File "/media/walker/Data/work/distiller/apputils/model_summaries.py", line 99, in init trace, _ = jit.get_trace_graph(model, dummy_input.cuda()) AttributeError: 'tuple' object has no attribute 'cuda' Could you help me to solve the problem?

comments.comment:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/HKLee2040>@HKLee2040</denchmark-link> , You can make a temporary change in apputils/model_summaries.py, line 99, as follows:
trace, _ = jit.get_trace_graph(model, dummy_input.cuda())
trace, _ = jit.get_trace_graph(model, dummy_input)
I'm not committing this code for now because for the general case (i.e. image classification application), this single change will require some other code changes. We are freezing 'master' for a few days while we finalize PyTorch 1.0 support. Cheers, Nets
